head.citation-title: 13th EAI International Conference on Communications and Networking in China, ChinaCom 2018
head.abstracts: The proceedings contain 71 papers. The special focus in this conference is on Communications and Networking in China. The topics include: Cluster-based caching strategy with limited storage in ultra dense networks; image retrieval research based on significant regions; partial systematic polar coding; an adaptive code rate control of polar codes in time-varying gaussian channel; the quaternion-fourier transform and applications; an optimized algorithm on multi-view transform for gait recognition; A novel real-time EEG based eye state recognition system; tracking performance of improved convex combination adaptive filter based on maximum correntropy criterion; Module selection algorithm based on WSS/SSS-hybrid AoD node in dynamic elastic optical networks; MIMO-UFMC transceiver schemes for millimeter wave wireless communications; Joint optimization of energy efficiency and interference for green WLANs; User assisted dynamic RAN notification area configuration scheme for 5G inactive UEs; Transmission capacity analysis of distributed scheduling in LTE-V2V mode 4 communication; A time-slot based coordination mechanism between WiFi and IEEE 802.15.4; Modeling a datacenter state through a novel weight corrected AHP algorithm; research on semantic role labeling method; network load minimization-based virtual network embedding algorithm for software-defined networking; joint user association and content placement for D2D-enabled heterogeneous cellular networks; hybrid caching transmission scheme for delay-sensitive service in vehicular networks; predictive time division transmission algorithm for segmented caching in vehicular networks; A novel mixed-variable fireworks optimization algorithm for path and time sequence optimization in WRSNs; Secrecy sum rate optimization in MIMO NOMA OSTBC systems with imperfect eavesdropper CSI; network-coding-based Cooperative V2V communication in vehicular cloud networks.

translated-sourcetitle.$: Lecture Notes of the Institute for Computer Sciences, Social-Informatics and Telecommunications Engineering, LNICST
